Description: The maximum power that the battery can import from the grid
The maximum power that the battery can export to the grid
Maximum volume of energy that the battery can store
Fraction of energy imported from grid that is lost prior to storage in the battery
Fraction of energy exported from the battery that is lost prior to reaching the grid

Maximum battery lifetime in battery cycles equivalent - one cycle is defined as charging up to max storage volume and then discharging all stored energy. This does not have to be done in one go - e.g. charging up to 75%, discharging to 0%, then charging up to 25% and discharging to 0% still counts as one cycle.
Percentage loss of storage volume per battery cycle (note: in %, not as a fraction)
Cost of purchasing and installing the battery
Annual overhead costs for operating the battery in electricity markets
